page.title: 08PARKS IN LEIGHTON BUZZARD
page.content:
The two parks in Leighton Buzzard are well kept by the Town Council, the grass is cut regularly and the flower gardens tended. Pages Park is well set out, divided into two parts by an avenue of trees. On one side are the sports facilities, these include a cricket pitch, tennis courts, football and hockey pitches. The other side of the park has a childrens playground which has swings, roundabouts, seesaws and a slide.
Parsons Close does not have the sporting facilities as found at Pages Park but has a paddling pool for the children in summer and a bandstand. People visiting the parks may make use of the facilities, make their own amusement, sit or walk. Dogs are taken for walks but this causes controversy because of the mess they make.
